revision.text:
{{distinguish|text=the Australian rules footballer, [[Callum Chambers]]}} {{EngvarB|date=December 2018}} {{Use dmy dates|date=December 2018}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Calum Chambers | image = Calum Chambers cropped.jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = Chambers after winning the [[2014 FA Community Shield]] with [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] | fullname = Calum Chambers{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=2 February 2018 |accessdate=10 February 2018}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1995|1|20|df=y}}{{Hugman|26074|accessdate=1 April 2016}} | birth_place = [[Petersfield]], England | height = {{convert|1.82|m|order=flip}}{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/players/4620/Calum-Chambers/overview |title=Calum Chambers: Overview |publisher=Premier League |accessdate=18 December 2017}} | position = [[Defender (association football)|Defender]] | currentclub = [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]]
(on loan from [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]]) | clubnumber = 5 | youthyears1 = 2002–2012 | youthclubs1 = [[Southampton F.C. Academy|Southampton]] | years1 = 2012–2014 | clubs1 = [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] | caps1 = 22 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2014– | clubs2 = [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] | caps2 = 48 | goals2 = 2 | years3 = 2016–2017 | clubs3 = → [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] (loan) | caps3 = 24 | goals3 = 1 | years4 = 2018– | clubs4 = → [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] (loan) | caps4 = 19 | goals4 = 1 | nationalyears1 = 2012 | nationalteam1 = [[England national under-17 football team|England U17]] | nationalcaps1 = 6 | nationalgoals1 = 3 | nationalyears2 = 2012–2014 | nationalteam2 = [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]] | nationalcaps2 = 18 | nationalgoals2 = 2 | nationalyears3 = 2015–2017 | nationalteam3 = [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] | nationalcaps3 = 22 | nationalgoals3 = 0 | nationalyears4 = 2014– | nationalteam4 = [[England national football team|England]] | nationalcaps4 = 3 | nationalgoals4 = 0 | club-update = 08:44, 10 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 12:25, 30 January 2019 (UTC) }} '''Calum Chambers''' (born 20 January 1995) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)|defender]] for [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]], on [[Loan (sports)|loan]] from fellow {{English football updater|Arsenal}} club [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]], and the [[England national football team|England national team]]. Originally a member of [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]]'s [[Southampton F.C. Academy|academy system]], Chambers was promoted to the first team at the beginning of the [[2012–13 Southampton F.C. season|2012–13]] campaign. After two seasons with the club, he moved to fellow Premier League club Arsenal. Chambers made his senior international debut for the [[England national football team|English national team]] in 2014. ==Club career== ===Southampton=== Born in [[Petersfield]], Hampshire, Chambers joined [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] at the age of seven.{{cite news |url=http://metro.co.uk/2014/07/14/who-is-arsenal-target-calum-chambers-4798262/ |title=Who is Arsenal target Calum Chambers? |author=James Phillips |newspaper=Metro |location=London |date=14 July 2014 |accessdate=3 August 2014}} He went through the ranks at the club and at the beginning of the [[2012–13 Southampton F.C. season|2012–13 season]], Chambers was revealed as one of four youth players to be promoted to the first-team.{{cite web |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/article/numbers-up-for-saints-318707.aspx |title=Numbers up for Saints |publisher=Southampton F.C. |date=17 August 2012 |accessdate=29 August 2012}} During the pre-season period he made a number of appearances for the team, playing in the Memorial Cup against [[R.S.C. Anderlecht|Anderlecht]],{{cite web |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/article/memorial-cup-report-237234.aspx?pageView=full#anchored |title=Memorial Cup − Report |publisher=Southampton F.C. |date=14 July 2012 |accessdate=29 August 2012}} coming on as a second-half substitute in the matches against [[Thonon Évian Savoie F.C.|Évian Thonon Gaillard]] and [[Étoile Carouge FC|Étoile Carouge]],{{cite web |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/article/evian-tg-0-1-saints-report-291272.aspx?pageView=full#anchored |title=Évian TG 0–1 Saints − Report |publisher=Southampton F.C. |date=21 July 2012 |accessdate=29 August 2012}}{{cite web |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/article/etoile-carouge-1-4-saints-report-291269.aspx?pageView=full#anchored |title=Etoile Carouge 1–4 Saints − Report |publisher=Southampton F.C. |date=18 July 2012 |accessdate=29 August 2012}} and making late appearances against [[AFC Ajax|Ajax]] and [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]].{{cite web |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/article/saints-0-1-ajax-report-275919.aspx?pageView=full#anchored |title=Saints 0–1 Ajax − Report |publisher=Southampton F.C. |date=28 July 2012 |accessdate=29 August 2012}}{{cite web |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/article/saints-2-0-wolves-report-292113.aspx?pageView=full#anchored |title=Saints 2–0 Wolves − Report |publisher=Southampton F.C. |date=4 August 2012 |accessdate=29 August 2012}} Chambers made his full debut for Southampton on 28 August 2012 in a 4–1 win over [[Stevenage F.C.|Stevenage]] in the second round of the [[2012–13 Football League Cup|League Cup]], coming on as an 84th-minute substitute for [[Dean Hammond]] and providing the assist for the final goal of the match by [[Ben Reeves]].{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/19340365 |title=Stevenage 1–4 Southampton |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 August 2012 |accessdate=11 April 2017}} On 31 July 2013, Chambers signed a new four-year contract with Southampton.{{cite web |title=Chambers commits to Saints |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/article/chambers-commits-to-saints-958138.aspx |publisher=Southampton F.C. |accessdate=1 August 2013 |date=31 July 2013}} He made his first-team league debut on 17 August 2013, when he played the full 90 minutes at right-back of the opening match of the [[2013–14 Premier League|2013–14]] season in a 1–0 win against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]].{{cite news |first=Neil |last=Johnston |title=West Brom 0–1 Southampton |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/23644676 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 August 2013 |accessdate=11 April 2017}} He made a total of 25 appearances for Southampton in all competitions, of which 22 were in the league, before leaving in the summer of 2014. ===Arsenal=== [[File:Calum ChambersOct2014.JPG|thumb|upright|Chambers (right) playing for [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] in 2014]] On 28 July 2014, it was announced that he had signed for [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] on a long-term contract for an undisclosed fee, rising to a potential £16 million with performance-related add-ons.{{cite web |title=Calum Chambers signs for Arsenal |url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/20140728/calum-chambers-completes-move-to-arsenal |publisher=Arsenal F.C. |accessdate=28 July 2014 |date=28 July 2014}}{{cite news |title=Arsenal sign Calum Chambers from Southampton in deal rising to £16m |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/jul/28/arsenal-sign-calum-chambers-southampton |accessdate=28 July 2014 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=28 July 2014}} Chambers made his first appearance for Arsenal on 2 August 2014, starting in central defence in a 5–1 win against [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]] in the pre-season [[Emirates Cup]] tournament.{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/aug/02/arsenal-benfica-emirates-cup-match-report |title=Arsenal's Yaya Sanogo hits four in friendly rout of Benfica |date=2 August 2014 |accessdate=3 August 2014 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London}} On 10 August, Chambers made his competitive debut for Arsenal, playing the full 90 minutes of the [[2014 FA Community Shield]] against Premier League champions [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] at [[Wembley Stadium]]. Playing at centre back instead of his usual right back position to cover for [[Per Mertesacker]], the BBC wrote on his performance against the Premier League champions that "his mature performance defied his youthful years".{{cite news |first=Mandeep |last=Sanghera |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/28647186 |title=Arsenal 3–0 Manchester City |publisher=BBC Sport |date=10 August 2014 |accessdate=11 April 2017}} On 16 August, Chambers played his first [[Premier League]] match for Arsenal in a 2–1 win against [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]].{{cite news |first=Saj |last=Chowdhury |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/28718788 |title=Arsenal 2–1 Crystal Palace |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 August 2014 |accessdate=11 April 2017}} He played the first European fixture of his career three days later, a goalless draw in the first leg of Arsenal's Champions League play-off away to [[Beşiktaş J.K.|Beşiktaş]].{{cite news |first=Chris |last=Bevan |title=Besiktas 0–0 Arsenal |url=http://bbc.co.uk/sport/football/28784340 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=19 August 2014 |accessdate=11 April 2017}} Following a strong start to the season, Chambers was nominated for the [[Golden Boy (award)|Golden Boy Award 2014]], alongside international teammates [[Raheem Sterling]], [[Luke Shaw]] and [[John Stones]].{{cite news |last=Richards |first=Alex |title=England pair Raheem Sterling and Calum Chambers join Adnan Januzaj in Golden Boy award nominations |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/england-pair-raheem-sterling-calum-4523237 |accessdate=28 October 2014 |newspaper=Daily Mirror |location=London |date=28 October 2014}} He scored the first senior goal of his career and registered an assist on 1 November as Arsenal beat [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] 3–0 in a Premier League home victory.{{cite news |last=Gheerbrant |first=James |title=Arsenal 3–0 Burnley |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/29768015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=1 November 2014 |accessdate=11 April 2017}} He was sent off for the first time in his career on 6 December, as Arsenal lost 3–2 at [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]].{{cite news |last=Chowdhury |first=Saj |title=Stoke City 3–2 Arsenal |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/30257121 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=6 December 2014 |accessdate=11 April 2017}} Chambers' appearances in the second half of the season were limited by the emergence of [[Héctor Bellerín]] at right-back.{{cite news |last=Fernandez-Abascal |first=Eduardo |title=Héctor Bellerín will 'fight' Mathieu Debuchy for Arsenal right-back slot after breakthrough season |url=http://www.ibtimes.co.uk/hector-bellerin-will-fight-mathieu-debuchy-arsenal-right-back-slot-after-breakthrough-season-1503876 |accessdate=2 June 2015 |work=International Business Times |date=1 June 2015}} He was not in Arsenal's matchday squad when they won the [[2015 FA Cup Final]] 4–0 against [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] at Wembley Stadium on 30 May.{{cite news |last=McNulty |first=Phil |title=Arsenal 4–0 Aston Villa |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/32856754 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=30 May 2015 |accessdate=11 April 2017}} Chambers began the [[2016–17 Premier League]] in the starting line-up for Arsenal and scored in a 3–4 loss against [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] in the first match of the season.{{cite news |last=Chowdhury |first=Saj |title=Arsenal 3–4 Liverpool |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37001073 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=14 August 2016 |accessdate=11 April 2017}} ===Middlesbrough (loan)=== [[File:Calum Chambers*.jpg|thumb|upright|Chambers playing for [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] in 2016]] On 30 August 2016, he joined fellow Premier League team [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] on a season-long [[Loan (sports)|loan]].{{cite news |title=Calum Chambers: Middlesbrough sign Arsenal defender on loan |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37218210 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=30 August 2016 |accessdate=19 July 2017}} ===Return to Arsenal=== Chambers made his first appearance of the [[2017–18 Arsenal F.C. season|2017–18 season]] in the 1–0 win over [[Doncaster Rovers F.C.|Doncaster Rovers]] in the [[EFL Cup]], but was substituted at half time due to injury.{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/arsenal-vs-doncaster/384183 |title=Arsenal 1–0 Doncaster |publisher=Sky Sports |date=21 September 2017 |accessdate=4 October 2017}} On 3 July 2018, Chambers signed a new long-term contract with Arsenal.{{cite web |title=Calum Chambers signs contract extension |url=https://www.arsenal.com/news/calum-chambers-signs-contract-extension |publisher=Arsenal F.C. |accessdate=3 July 2018 |date=3 July 2018}} ===Fulham (loan)=== On 7 August 2018, Chambers signed with fellow Premier League side [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] on a season long loan.{{cite web |title=Calum Chambers joins Fulham on loan |url=https://www.arsenal.com/news/calum-chambers-joins-fulham-loan |accessdate=7 August 2018 |date=7 August 2018}} ==International career== Chambers made his debut for the [[England national under-17 football team|England under-17 team]] on 2 February against [[Portugal national under-17 football team|Portugal]].{{cite web |url=http://www.thefa.com/England/All-Teams/Players/C/calum-chambers |title=Calum Chambers |publisher=The Football Association |accessdate=29 August 2012}} In March, he played in all three of the team's matches in the [[2012 UEFA European Under-17 Championship elite round]], scoring their only goal of the tournament in a 1–0 win over [[Ukraine national under-17 football team|Ukraine]].{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/under17/season=2012/teams/player=250047102/index.html |title=Calum Chambers |publisher=UEFA |accessdate=29 August 2012}} On 26 September 2012, Chambers made the step up to the [[England national under-19 football team|England under-19 team]], playing the full 90 minutes in the team's 3–0 win over the [[Estonia national youth football team#Estonia National Under-19 Squad|Estonia under-19 team]] in the [[2013 UEFA European Under-19 Championship qualification|2013 UEFA European Under-19 Championship qualifying round]].{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/under19/season=2013/matches/round=2000318/match=2009284/index.html |title=England-Estonia |publisher=UEFA |accessdate=27 September 2012}} On 28 September Chambers came on as a second-half substitute in the England under-19 team's match against the [[Faroe Islands national under-19 football team|Faroe Islands]], which England won 6–0, scoring the final goal of the match in the 84th minute.{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/under19/season=2013/matches/round=2000318/match=2009308/index.html |title=Faroe Islands-England |publisher=UEFA |accessdate=28 September 2012}} He scored his second under-19 international goal in a 1–0 victory against [[Turkey national under-19 football team|Turkey]] on 21 March 2013.{{cite web |last=Veevers |first=Nichols |title=Chambers clinches win as England U19s head off to elite round on back of 1–0 win over Turkey |url=http://www.thefa.com/England/mens-u19s/News/2013/turkey-report-210313 |publisher=The Football Association |accessdate=22 March 2013 |date=21 March 2013}} On 28 August 2014, he was named in the senior England squad for the first time, ahead of a friendly against [[Norway national football team|Norway]] and a [[UEFA Euro 2016 qualifying|Euro 2016 qualification match]] against [[Switzerland national football team|Switzerland]] in September.{{cite web |title=Roy calls up four new faces for Norway and Switzerland |url=http://www.thefa.com/news/england/2014/aug/norway-switzerland-squad-announcement-rose-colback-delph-chambers |accessdate=28 August 2014 |publisher=The Football Association |date=28 August 2014}} He made his debut against Norway on 3 September, coming on for the last 9 minutes in place of John Stones as England won 1–0 at Wembley Stadium.{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=England 1–0 Norway |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/28947896 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=3 September 2014 |accessdate=11 April 2017}} Initially chosen for the [[England national under-21 football team|under-21 team]], Chambers moved into the senior squad ahead of European qualifiers against [[San Marino national football team|San Marino]] and [[Estonia national football team|Estonia]] in October 2014 due to an injury to Stones.{{cite news |title=England: John Stones replaced by Calum Chambers in squad |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/29497934 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=5 October 2014 |accessdate=11 April 2017}} He was given his first start on his second cap, against San Marino on 9 October at Wembley Stadium, playing at right back ahead of his former Southampton teammate [[Nathaniel Clyne]].{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=England 5–0 San Marino |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/29454223 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=9 October 2014 |accessdate=11 April 2017}} Chambers then dropped back down to the under-21 team in March 2015, and made his debut in a 1–0 win against [[Czech Republic national under-21 football team|Czech Republic]] in Prague.{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/mar/27/czech-republic-england-under-21s-friendly-match-report |title=Tom Carroll scores winner for England Under-21s against Czech Republic |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=27 March 2015 |accessdate=28 March 2015}} He was part of the team that won the [[2016 Toulon Tournament]], their first such win for 22 years.{{cite news |title=England Under-21s win Toulon Tournament for first time in 22 years |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36410296 |accessdate=29 May 2016 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=29 May 2016}} On 5 June 2017, Chambers was called up to England's squad for the [[2017 UEFA European Under-21 Championship]] to be held in Poland.{{cite web |url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/20170605/england-call-for-chambers-and-holding |title=England call for Chambers and Holding |publisher=Arsenal F.C. |date=5 June 2017 |accessdate=5 June 2017}} Chambers went on to play in the semi-final of the tournament where England went out on penalties to Germany.{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/under21/season=2017/matches/round=2000646/match=2022540/index.html |title=England 2–2 Germany: Germany win 4–3 on penalties |publisher=UEFA}} ==Career statistics== ===Club=== season|2014–15]]{{soccerbase season|66152|2014|accessdate=1 April 2016}} |Premier League |23||1||4||0||1||0||7{{efn|name=UCL|Appearances in [[UEFA Champions League]]}}||0||1{{efn|Appearance in [[FA Community Shield]]}}||0||36||1 |- |[[2015–16 Arsenal F.C. season|2015–16]]{{soccerbase season|66152|2015|accessdate=6 September 2016}} |Premier League |12||0||5||1||2||0||3{{efn|name=UCL}}||0||0||0||22||1 |- |[[2016–17 Arsenal F.C. season|2016–17]] |Premier League |1||1||colspan=2|—||colspan=2|—||colspan=2|—||colspan=2|—||1||1 |- |[[2017–18 Arsenal F.C. season|2017–18]]{{soccerbase season|66152|2017|accessdate=24 August 2018}} |Premier League |12||0||0||0||4||0||8{{efn|Appearances in [[UEFA Europa League]]}}||0||colspan=2|—||24||0 |- !colspan=2|Total !48||2||9||1||7||0||18||0||1||0||83||3 |- |[[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] (loan) |[[2016–17 Middlesbrough F.C. season|2016–17]]{{soccerbase season|66152|2016|accessdate=19 July 2017}} |Premier League |24||1||2||0||colspan=2|—||colspan=2|—||colspan=2|—||26||1 |- |[[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] (loan) |[[2018–19 Fulham F.C. season|2018–19]]{{soccerbase season|66152|2018|accessdate=30 January 2019}} |Premier League |17||1||1||0||1||0||colspan=2|—||colspan=2|—||19||1 |- !colspan=3|Career total !111||4||12||1||11||0||18||0||1||0||153||5 |} {{notelist}} ===International=== {{updated|match played 12 October 2014}}{{NFT player |id=56800 |name=Chambers, Calum |accessdate=30 January 2019}} {| class=wikitable style=text-align:center |+ Appearances and goals by national team and year |- !National team!!Year!!Apps!!Goals |- |[[England national football team|England]] |2014||3||0 |- !colspan=2|Total||3||0 |} ==Honours== [[File:Arsenal FA Cup Winners Parade (18163652599).jpg|thumb|upright|Chambers (centre) during the victory parade that followed Arsenal's victory in the [[2015 FA Cup Final]]]] '''Arsenal''' *[[FA Community Shield]]: [[2014 FA Community Shield|2014]] '''England U21''' *[[Toulon Tournament]]: [[2016 Toulon Tournament|2016]] {{-}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{commons category}}
